unit_learning_outcomes.description: Assess and evaluate contemporary Australian and international creative writing in print and digital modes.
Analyse and appraise the work of others in writing communities utilizing interpersonal skills and creative writing terms, vocabulary and narrative studies concepts.
Apply technical creative writing terms, vocabulary and narrative studies concepts in the analysis of texts.
Evidence close reading skills in the reading of creative writing texts.
Plan, write, edit and rewrite short-form creative works.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: In preparation for completion of the Book Proposal or Journal Report, undertake research that may include: literary journals, industry standard book proposals, publisher and literary agent and competition submission requirements.
Reading set texts and the creative work of peers in preparation for discussions, quizzes, and writing workshops (online or in-class).

assessments.description: Students select to write either a report and analysis of a recent issue of an Australian journal of creative writing/literature/cultural analysis; or a book proposal for a story or poetry cycle.
Two online quizzes enable students to review and consolidate the concepts, topics, and content of the readings and lectures.

data.subject_search_title: ENGX8022 - Short Form Writing - Short Story, Novella, Poetry Cycle

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit focuses on short-form creative writing in its evolving forms, including micro narratives and the short story, poetry cycles, the short story sequence and novella. In addition to writing workshops, students read Australian and international short-form writing, and narrative studies texts that investigate questions of form  and the relationship of the reader to the text. Students develop a critical awareness of the broader national and international contexts in which short-form writing is published. At the conclusion of the unit, students will have produced a range of short-form creative works and a book plan.
